docs.snippet: Companies like Facebook must face stricter regulation and tougher penalties meted out by better equipped data-protection authorities, Germany's justice minister said on Monday after a meeting with senior executives from the company.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Must Face Stricter Regulation: German Minister
headline.main: Facebook Must Face Stricter Regulation: German Minister

headline.main: Russia, Stormy Daniels, Facebook: Your Tuesday Briefing

docs.snippet: Israel is investigating Facebook Inc. over possible infringement of its citizens' privacy following reports that British consultancy Cambridge Analytica improperly accessed users' information, the Justice Ministry said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Israel Investigating Facebook Over Privacy Concerns
headline.main: Israel Investigating Facebook Over Privacy Concerns

docs.snippet: Oregon's attorney general says she is reviewing whether to launch an investigation of Facebook, including whether it violated a state law that protects online customers' private information.

headline.print_headline: Oregon Attorney General Considers Investigating Facebook
headline.main: Oregon Attorney General Considers Investigating Facebook

docs.snippet: A U.S. Senate subcommittee on Thursday sought information from a Cambridge University researcher about how the personal data of 50 million Facebook users landed in the hands of a political consulting firm that worked for U.S. President Donald Trum...

headline.print_headline: Senate Subcommittee Seeks Information on Facebook Data
headline.main: Senate Subcommittee Seeks Information on Facebook Data

docs.snippet: With European and U.S. lawmakers calling for investigations into reports that Facebook user data was accessed by UK based consultancy Cambridge Analytica to help President Donald Trump win the 2016 election, investors are asking even more question...

docs.snippet: Facebook is having one of its worst weeks as a publicly traded company with a share sell-off continuing for a second day.

headline.main: Facebook Under Pressure Again, UK Promises Investigation

docs.snippet: Democratic Senator Ron Wyden on Monday sent a letter to Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg asking for answers to questions regarding the social media company's policies for sharing user data with third parties.

headline.print_headline: Democratic Senator Asks Zuckerberg About Facebook Data
headline.main: Democratic Senator Asks Zuckerberg About Facebook Data
